title: University English Oral Training Interaction Design: Mobile Microlearning Based on an Integrated Task Model

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: A short, intensive course focused on enhancing pre-service and in-service elementary teachers' oral English communication skills within a mathematics curriculum context, implementable in a smartphone-based, limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: Learners can improve oral presentation skills explaining math-related topics (e.g., fraction calculations, geometry concepts) in English
Learners can perform integrated reading-listening-speaking tasks with 80% accuracy through mobile-based voice feedback with peer teachers
Learners achieve a 20% improvement in oral communication scores in formative assessments based on the Communicative Language Assessment (CLA) model

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
